cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles SSW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend and then the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key–Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to the Middle of Longboat Key
weather_observation.warning_coast: Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Naples through Tampa Bay to the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (91% chance) with a 32% chance of 50-kt winds and a small (≈8%) chance of hurricane-force gusts around the port Tuesday night into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 4–7 ft possible in Tampa Bay and along the immediate coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches likely with isolated totals up to 12 inches, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible late Tuesday and Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
